Cobalt.Definition: Inorganic Compound;Metal;Cobalt Compound; Cobalt is a metallic element with the atomic number 27. It is found naturally in rocks, soil, water, plants, and animals, and is mainly used to produce alloys and pigments. In small amounts cobalt is an essential element for life, as it is part of vitamin B12. However, excess exposure is known to exhibit toxic effects. Cobalt also exists in the toxic radioactive form Cobalt-60.
